databaseAccess
Class QueryDB

java.lang.Object
  databaseAccess.QueryDB

public class QueryDB
extends java.lang.Object

Main database interface for all database tasks. Tasks include connecting to the database, adding new songs, searching for existing songs, adding new users, and deleting users and songs.

Author:
Shaun Brockhoff

Constructor Detail

QueryDB

public QueryDB()
Method Detail

startDatabase

public boolean startDatabase(java.lang.String url,
                             java.lang.String user,
                             java.lang.String pass)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
Creates a new connection to the database and initializes the driver.

Parameters:
url - - database URL
user - - database username
pass - - database password
Returns:
true if the database connected successfully
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if the connection fails.

closeDatabase

public void closeDatabase()
Closes the connection to the database for this instance.

insertSongIntoDatabase

public boolean insertSongIntoDatabase(SongData song,
                                      java.lang.String owner)
Attempts to insert a new song into the database. This method will return false if there is a SQLException of any kind, including if the user attempts to insert a duplicate song.

Parameters:
song - - Object that contains all the information pertaining to the song
owner - - Owner of the song. Used to determine permissions for viewing, deleting, etc.
Returns:
true on successful insertion, false otherwise

simpleSearch

public java.util.List<SongData> simpleSearch(java.lang.String searchString,
                                             int sortType,
                                             java.lang.String owner)
Takes in a broad search term and queries all the pertinent fields that the user is allowed to search for including performers0,1,2, title, and artist. It is also used to simply return all songs (visible to the user) such as from the "View Music Collection" link.

Parameters:
searchString - - Broad search term
sortType - - What field to sort by (defined in Controller)
owner - - Currently logged in user. Compared with owner field in database to determine which songs this user can view.
Returns:
a List of type SongData of the search results

deleteSong

public boolean deleteSong(java.lang.String fileName,
                          java.lang.String owner)
Delete a song from the database by comparing the fileName parameter with all file names in the database. No two songs can have the same file name.

Parameters:
fileName - - the file name to search for in the database
owner - - the currently logged in user. Used to make sure user has permissions delete the file
Returns:
true if the song was successfully deleted, false on any SQLException

deleteUser

public boolean deleteUser(java.lang.String nameToDelete,
                          java.lang.String currentUser)
Delete a user from the database. Method verifies that the user is an admin before allowing the deletion.

Parameters:
nameToDelete - - user to delete from the database
currentUser - - currently logged in user.
Returns:
true if successfully deleted, false if not admin or on any SQLException

addUser

public boolean addUser(java.lang.String user,
                       byte[] password)
Create a new user in the database. Provide a username and a hashed password. Query will fail if the user attempts to create a user that already exists.

Parameters:
user - - new user to add
password - - hashed password to associate with user
Returns:
true if user was successfully added, false on SQLException (will be thrown if user already exists).

getHashedPassword

public byte[] getHashedPassword(java.lang.String user)

getAllUsers

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllUsers()
Returns:
a list of all the users for administration purposes. Returns null if any error.

search

public java.util.List<SongData> search(java.lang.String broadTerm,
                                       java.lang.String title,
                                       java.lang.String artist,
                                       java.lang.String album,
                                       int sortBy,
                                       java.lang.String username)
/** Takes in a broad search term, multiple search terms (artist, title, album), the join type (AND/OR), the field to sort by (enum defined in Controller), and the currently logged in user.

Parameters:
broadTerm - - broad search term
title - - title to search for
artist - - artist to search for
album - - album to search for
sortBy - - what field to sort by (defined in Controller)
username - - currently logged in user - used to determine what results are returned
Returns:
a List of type SongData containing all the songs in the search result

handleSQLException

public static void handleSQLException(java.sql.SQLException sqle)
Convenience method for DatabaseUtil.handleSQLException(sqle, System.err);

Parameters:
sqle - The exception to handle.
